meanings.definition: A muscle that turns a part outward or inside out
meanings.sent1: The evertors in my ankle help me turn my foot outward.
meanings.sent2: During the exercise, the evertors in her leg were working hard.
meanings.sent3: The evertors in the bodybuilder's legs were so strong, they could turn his feet outward effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the evertors in a machine, always ready to turn things around.
meanings.sent5: The evertors in the wrist are like little helpers, always ready to twist things outward.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that causes something to turn outward or inside out
meanings.sent1: The evertors on the telescope allowed it to turn outward to see the stars.
meanings.sent2: The evertors on the camera lens made it easy to flip the image inside out.
meanings.sent3: The evertors on the toy robot made it spin around in circles, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: The evertors on the door handle made it feel like a magical portal, turning everything inside out.
meanings.sent5: The evertors on the umbrella were so smooth, they could effortlessly flip it inside out during a strong wind.
